page.title: 20Portsmouth in 2085 AD ?
page.content: A{survey}of 676{twelve year olds}in Portsmouth shows that most think the city will be{very different}in future. Most(71%) think nuclear war will not happen, and believe{Portsmouth}will be larger and more important. There will be: a{new type of travel -more economic and safer; a 'science fiction' world with{robots and space {colonies. An increase in{crime}is feared by 63% and 88% expect a decrease in {church}attendance.{Unemployment}will increase, but{vegetarians}will still be in a minority according to 69%. Children may (?){read}books (50-50) but will have more{money}to spend. Portsmouth Football Club will not be in the Second Division say 89% of these{optimistic adults}of tomorrow. -Simon Dennis: Portsmouth Grammar School
